body_html:
I hadn't seen CyberAgent/adbkit until poking through sole/install-to-adb - very cool!

So, I think I could use that shell hack from ADB Helper to look up device IDs with a combo of listDevices and shell. Then, listForwards accepts device IDs - which can then discover pre-existing port forwards specifically to FxOS devices. And, wherever a forward hasn't been done, we can make one with adbkit's forward.

Not sure about un-forwarding, though. Might not be all that necessary: If we can detect existing forwards, we reuse them. So, hopefully they won't pile up. I guess they'll all get cleaned up with the adb daemon dies?

I think I'll play with that stuff tonight / tomorrow morning. Just thinking aloud in this comment in case I forget how to computer or something

body:
I hadn't seen [CyberAgent/adbkit](https://github.com/CyberAgent/adbkit) until poking through [sole/install-to-adb](https://github.com/sole/install-to-adb) - very cool!

So, I think I could use that shell hack from ADB Helper to look up device IDs with a combo of [listDevices](https://github.com/CyberAgent/adbkit#clientlistdevicescallback) and [shell](https://github.com/CyberAgent/adbkit#clientshellserial-command-callback). Then, [listForwards](https://github.com/CyberAgent/adbkit#clientlistforwardsserial-callback) accepts device IDs - which can then discover pre-existing port forwards specifically to FxOS devices. And, wherever a forward hasn't been done, we can make one with adbkit's [forward](https://github.com/CyberAgent/adbkit#clientforwardserial-local-remote-callback). 

Not sure about un-forwarding, though. Might not be all that necessary: If we can detect existing forwards, we reuse them. So, hopefully they won't pile up. I guess they'll all get cleaned up with the adb daemon dies?

I think I'll play with that stuff tonight / tomorrow morning. Just thinking aloud in this comment in case I forget how to computer or something
